result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus J Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Must obtain GED/HSED.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bar/tavern.
Authorized under 973.015 must fully complete all conditions of probation.
The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or self-help group per week and is to provided proof of attendance to P&P.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed within the first 18 months.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus J Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcus J Morris in court with attorney David Vernon Penn.  Defendant Marcus J Morris in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:09 AM. Both counsel have received the revocation paperwork with no inaccuracies. State makes argument prior to recommendation (205 days credit) - recommends 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES with credit for 205 days (stipulated). Penn makes argument prior to recommendaton - recommends 270 days in county jail with credit for 205 days credit with good time for basically a time served sentence. Morris withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 3 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, credit for 205 days, not eligible for programs, for the unpaid fines -  25% of any accounts maintained in the prison system can be applied toward the fines and all fines must be paid in full within 60 days/CO - consecutive to any other sentence that he may be serving, right to appeal, adjourned. Back on record at 10:45 AM with same appearances. Penn has questions on the money owed by the defendant and how does he pay them and to where. Clerk informed the Court that the defendant paid the court in full. Court states that he didn't order a civil judgment for unpaid fines because he found that the defendant had the ability to pay. Discussion on any fees owed. Court accepts the clerks statement that no amount is due to the Court. He cannot order a judgment for any supervision fees, deletes the portion of the record that states that additional time will be added if fines are unpaid in 60 days.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sent to Chuck and JA via email and JA informed to schedule SEHR
30 days jail without huber - to begin when signed by Judge

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcus J Morris in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:38 PM. Called 16CF19, 16CF38 and 16CF112. State - here for PLEAS on 16CF19 and 16CF38 and AIA on 16CF112. State hands Lucareli with complaint for 16CF112. State is willing to dismiss and read in all the counts on 16CF112 to take care of all cases today. Recess to talk to client about that (1:40 PM). Recalled at 1:45 PM with same appearances. State moves to dismiss and read in all counts on 16CF38 and 16CF112. Defendant understands what it means to dismiss and read in charges/counts. Court dismisses and reads in all counts on 16CF112 and 16CF38. State- 16CF119 - #1 - DRI, #2 - G as alleged - 3 years probation with conditions of: fine of $1000.00 plus costs, AODA, reimburse FCDTF for $180.00 (joint and several), absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars, or similar establishments, employment/school, 200 hours of communioty service, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider, attend at least on AA or self-help group per week and provide proof of attendance with P&P officer, expungement recommended if fully completes all conditions of probation. Lucarelli and Morris agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Morris pleads G to count #2 as alleged with the enhancer. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutioanal rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Lucareli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Morris withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $1000.00 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO, AODA and follow thru, reimburse FCDTF for $180.00 (joint and several) - take bond posted first on this cost (60 days/CO), no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service - to be completed within the first 18 months of probation, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, obtain GED/HSED, attend at least on AA /NAor self-help group per week and provide proof of attendance with P&P officer, expungement authorized under 973.015 fully completes all conditions of probation, credit for 6 days only if revoked (stipulated), submit DNA sample with expungement rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus J Morris
Current: 620 Highview Drive, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2016)
Prior: 102 N Crandon Ave, Crandon, WI 54520
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus J Morris in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CF19 & 16CF38. Called 3:06 PM. Lucareli indicates there will be a waiver of PH on both cases and has resolved the cases, asks for PLEAS date. Court goes over waiver of PH form with defendant orally on the record. Court finds Morris is freely and voluntarily waiving his right to a PH on both cases. Court finds probable casue and binds over for trial in each case. State files INFOs which mirror the complaints. Lucareli and Morris have INFO, waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts on each case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 16CF38. State - believes the defendant is currently hospitalized for stated reasons. Lucareli found out this AM of that situation and have received confirmation of that today and faxed to Court and State. Court continues bond on both matters, and sets for another PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
From Attorney Lucareli requesting adjournment of PH due to defendant currently not available. Approved by Judge.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcus J Morris in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:54 AM. Also called 16CF38. Lucareli and Morris have complaint, waives reading of it, states that the defendant wants to go to inpatient treatment and has made the arrangements to begin that on 2/1/16, would like the matters set for March for stated reasons. Court continues bond on both matters, considers time limits waived on both matters, sets both matters for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Karley Bradley except for issues related to their child in common.

Defendant Marcus J Morris in court, in custody and via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:20 AM. Morris has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Morris understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own. Court sets for AIA and warns defendant on returning without an attorney. State - bond - $1000.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol, no contact with Karley Bradley. Morris understands and can post. Court - $1000.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Karley Bradley. Co-defendant's mother makes statement in regards to this defendant being the father of her grandchild with the co-defendant. State makes statement - follow whatever FCSS has set for placement. Court - conditions are no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Karley Bradley except for issues related to their child in common  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:45 am.
